alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 03 at 2:39PM PDT until November 04 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 4 inches and locally up to 5 inches in the valleys and 6 to 10 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Chewelah, St. Maries, Fernwood, Flowery Trail Road, Sandpoint, Deer Park, Athol, Newport, Priest River, Eastport, Colville, Northport, Dobson Pass, Lookout Pass, Springdale-Hunters Road, Kellogg, Orin-Rice Road, Pinehurst, Bonners Ferry, Osburn, Fourth Of July Pass, Wallace, Kettle Falls, Schweitzer Mountain Road, and Mullan. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Colder pockets of valleys could see wet and heavy snowfall with higher accumulations leading to potential tree damage. Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Warming temperatures through the morning Friday will result in snow transitioning over to rain.
info.instruction: Do not touch downed lines and report any power outages to your electric company. Travel is highly discouraged due to slick roadways and the possibility of downed trees and power lines.
